title: About Sona's Kit
body:
So, I used to want to main Sona. I loved the thematic so much, but this was back when I was newer, around season 5-6. Her kit just doesn't inspire any sort of "music" feel, it just feels like braindead facerolling. While I'm not a Sona player, I almost was long ago. To me, her kit has so much so potential, but it's wasted into lack-of-skill-expression bits.

I feel like she could be reworked into something of a combo caster, like Riven or Ryze, where you have to weave your abilities in the right way to get the desired effects. That would really bring out the "music" thematic, as playing music requires playing the right notes with control and timing, and knowing what you're doing.

Disclaimer: not saying she needs a rework, but the thematic has so much wasted potential on what could've been a beautiful kit.

Assassins (Talon), Mages, and even the couple ADCs in mid will make Sona's laning phase a nightmare. She's not a strong solo champion; her ratios are too low to take full advantage of getting solo farm, her mana costs are ridiculously high (Ahri punts her out of lane in a hurry), she doesn't have any real safety against ganks (Ult to stop a gank? Yeah, enjoy that 130s CD when Kayn comes back for some booty), and about a dozen other flaws.

The idea you're looking for is Invoker from DOTA (go look it up) or a watered down version of it. While I think a simpler version could definitely work, Riot has completely shot down that idea. 

And, for the record, I'm not entirely sure it's the best idea. A good idea and good option, but not inherently the best.


Making her basic abilities feel more like music would definitely help. I personally suggest making them act like waves that flow out and do whatever it is they do. 


And, interestingly enough, the only people who seem opposed to reworking Sona is Riot. Most Sona mains I've heard talk about her agree she needs a significant overhaul (myself included)
Unfortunately, Riot Meddler basically hates Sona, so that's not going to work out very well.

A while ago, I was brainstorming what might make Sona more interesting, and having her auras expand as a wave from around her was one of the ideas that I and the handful of people I shared it with enjoyed.

Then they did her joint mini-update with Leona where they screwed her laning phase in exchange for scaling, followed by successive nerfs to both, and I realized they really don't care that much.

Dude, check my posts
Not calling you out or anything, but it's actually an idea some other people have had
And maybe you'll like what I was thinking

In fact, there are plenty of ideas floating out there that people have in general agreed with. Rito ignores all of them.
ITT: we pretend that every champion must have complex/overloaded kits like Lee Sin, Jayce, Elise, or Thresh.

Bard's not really much of a bard, despite his name. Sona doesn't play out as much of a musician, despite her profession.

Riot doesn't particularly like her, either. She's been a balance "problem child" in the past (part of which was just knee-jerk nerfing, part of which was justified) and apart from skins she's usually left to her own â€” either she works OK due to item synergies, or she struggles due to a lack thereof.
She's already a bard; she plays music to buff her allies. There's more than one way to make 'musician' as a character trait work, you know.
You're not the only one. Sona is most criticized for being way too simple, but people, and apparently Riot themselves, defend it, so it is what it is. I don't think it'll ever change.

So there is a tiny bit of the feeling you're looking for in the proper use of Power Chords. You get a bonus on your basic attack every 3 spells, and the bonus depends on the last spell you used, so you have to use your spells in the right order to get the right Power Chord at the right time.

But granted, you can play a decent Sona without ever using her Power Chords consciously. That's just the difference between a good Sona and a great Sona, and if that's the feel you are looking for, it's not obvious in Sona's kit.

What if Sona's aura's had a little wave moving out from the center. Timing your spell casts when the wave reaches the end of the aura would amplify the ability slightly? It'd also go in tune with the music.

I don't really know how combos could work with Sona's kit because I'm thinking music and I'm thinking she only has 3 notes to play with lol.
About the three notes, yeah. But a lot can be done with few notes, as you can see in music. I've no idea where this can go, but it's just to fuel some thinking.
